post_text: So thankful to have heroes like Officer Rowland supporting our community and amazed by the bravery they show each and every day!
shared_text:
City of Chino Police Department
August 25 at 4:55 PM ·

*Tune in tonight at 11pm on NBC to see an interview with the family and Officer Rowland*

On Tuesday July 21st, just after 6:30 pm, the Chino Police Department received a 911 call regarding a possible drowning. The residents 20-month-old son Eden was found unresponsive in the pool. K9 Officer Rowland was first on scene and immediately took over CPR from the child’s mother. During chest compressions, Eden began to respond and opened his eyes. K9 Officer Rowland continued first aid until CVIFD Paramedics arrived and took over care. Eden was transported to Pomona Valley Hospital where he later started breathing on his own and was conscious and alert.

Due to the quick response and actions by K9 Officer Rowland and CVIFD personnel, we are happy to report that Eden has made a full recovery! Eden, his mom, and sister stopped by the station to drop off goodies and meet K9 Officer Rowland’s partner, Kobra.

#SpreadHopeCVUSD School closures throughout the nation have halted highly-anticipated campus events and activities with hundreds of thousands of students practicing social distancing at home. While our annual CVUSD Choral Festival—originally scheduled for Wednesday, March 18—has been cancelled, our Chino Hills HS Chamber Singers demonstrated resilience by recording their individual a cappella portion of Over the Rainbow in their separate homes, and through technology were able to appear together as a family again. Their harmonious performance is here for you, our CVUSD community, with the goal of spreading hope and cheer during this difficult time.
If you are a student at home while schools are closed, share with us how you are spending your time singing, dancing, cooking, learning a new language, painting, laughing, anything...we are in this together and we will get through it together.
